ALLEGED.Definition: said to be true but not proven

HYSTERIA.Definition: wild fear or emotion that spread

UNSETTLING.Definition: making you feel worried or scared

SETTLERS.Definition: people who had moved to the place to live

HUDDLED.Definition: staying close together, because of cold or fear

LURKING.Definition: hiding and waiting to do something bad

EDGING.Definition: moving slowly and carefully towards them

SMALLPOX.Definition: a deadly disease that caused spots and fever

GRIEVING.Definition: feeling very sad because someone had died

CREAK.Definition: a high sound made by something old or moving slowly

CHOKE.Definition: make you unable to breathe, strangle

CONGREGATION.Definition: a group of people at the church

PREACH.Definition: talk about religion in a serious way

PEST.Definition: small animal or bug that bothered people

BED BUGS.Definition: small insects that lived in beds and bit people

TORMENTORS.Definition: people who hurt or scared them on purpose

NAMED NAMES.Definition: told on others or gave their names to get them in trouble

OUTCASTS.Definition: people who were left out by the community

BEGGAR.Definition: a person who asked others for money or food

SCANDALOUS.Definition: shocking or very bad for reputation

VOODOO.Definition: a religion with spirits and magic, often misunderstood

CONFESSING.Definition: telling that she had done something bad

CONFESSION.Definition: a formal statement admitting that she was guilty

FUEL.Definition: something that would cause passion, argument, or other intense emotion

PROOF.Definition: something that showed it was true

SPREAD.Definition: moved from one person to another

PLAY ALONG.Definition: act like he agreed or believed in it

CONFESS.Definition: say he did something wrong, admit

DENY.Definition: say he didnâ€™t do something wrong, refuse to admit

TORTURE.Definition: practice of causing severe pain or suffering as punishment

CORROBORATE.Definition: say the same thing as them to show it was true

STUBBORN.Definition: not showing that he would change his mind

PANIC.Definition: sudden strong fear that made people act wild

CHOKING.Definition: making her not able to breathe, strangling

FAINTING.Definition: suddenly falling down because they felt weak or scared

GUILT.Definition: wrongdoing, being responsible for a crime or sin

GALLOWS.Definition: a wooden frame where people were hanged

RETRIBUTION.Definition: punishment for something bad someone had done

SETTLE SCORES.Definition: take revenge on someone for something that they had done in the past

VENGEANCE.Definition: hurting people back for what they had done to you

CYNICALLY.Definition: in a distrustful way that expresses a belief that people are motivated only by self-interest

AFTERMATH.Definition: the consequences or after-effects of the events

COMPENSATION.Definition: something given to make up for the losses

EXONERATED.Definition: officially said she was not guilty

FUNGUS.Definition: a plant-like thing that grows in damp places (like mould)

RYE.Definition: a grain used to make bread

CONVULSIONS.Definition: strong, uncontrolled shakings of the body

TWITCHING.Definition: making a sudden small movement with a part of the body

GRUDGES.Definition: bad feelings kept for a long time

BLAME.Definition: responsibility for a fault or wrong

SNOWBALLED.Definition: got bigger and worse very quickly

PILED ON.Definition: intensified or exaggerated things for effect
